data.title: “Svengoolie” presents his big premiere of “Count Yorga, Vampire” (1970); plus “Sventoonie” for Sven’s “Halloween ‘BOO’nanza;” this Sat. on Me-TV
data.meta_description: Fellow Svengoolie SvenPals will be jumping for joy for his upcoming big coast-to-coast broadcast premiere of a classic mammoth American-International vampire monster masterpiece. "Svengoolie" presents his big coast-to-coast broadcast premiere of "Count Yorga, Vampire" (1970) plus Sventoonie for Sven's "Halloween 'BOO'nanza" https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=G-z-ZfxSCHI Re-Constructed version of the original American-International Pictures theatrical release trailer of Bob Kelljan's…
data.text:
Fellow Svengoolie SvenPals will be jumping for joy for his upcoming big coast-to-coast broadcast premiere of a classic mammoth American-International vampire monster masterpiece.

“Svengoolie” presents his big coast-to-coast broadcast premiere of “Count Yorga, Vampire” (1970) plus Sventoonie for Sven’s “Halloween ‘BOO’nanza”

Re-Constructed version of the original American-International Pictures theatrical release trailer of Bob Kelljan’s “Count Yorga, Vampire” (1970); with the original 35mm film materials synced to the theatrical trailer audio from MGM with replica titles for the new Arrow Films-Arrow Video/MGM “The Count Yorga Collection” Blu-Ray box set. Viewer Discretion is Advised.

The legendary and iconic Berwyn/Chicago-based classic mammoth monster masterpiece film host will present his big coast-to-coast broadcast premiere of “Count Yorga, Vampire” (1970); this Sat., Oct. 29 at 8 p.m. Eastern/7 p.m. Central on Me-TV.

Sven’s upcoming big Me-TV broadcast premiere of “Count Yorga, Vampire” (1970) & upcoming big broadcast of “Sventoonie” will be featured in the fifth installment in Sven’s Saturday October “Halloween ‘BOO’nanza” month-long festival on the airlanes of Me-TV and will also mark the finale in Sven’s month-long/October “Halloween ‘BOO’nanza” finale, along with Sun. afternoon re-showing of “Svengoolie; Uncrypted” and a Sun. afternoon Sven-hosted festival of the classic mammoth Universal mystery-supernatural adaptation series, “Kolchak: The Night Stalker.” -C.H.

The classic mammoth 1970 vampire monster masterpiece production was directed by veteran feature film actor-turned-feature film & TV director Bob Kelljan. One of Kelljan’s earliest acting appearances was in an episode of Alfred Hitchcock‘s classic mammoth MCA-Universal (Revue) TV mystery anthology series, “Alfred Hitchcock Presents” (in the 1960 episode “Forty Detectives Later” with James Franciscus and Jack Weston). Kelljan also wrote the screenplay for his classic mammoth 1970 American-International monster-vampire masterpiece production of “Count Yorga, Vampire.”

Kelljan’s production of “Count Yorga, Vampire” (1970) was released theatrically through Samuel Z. Arkoff and James H. Nicholson’s American-International Pictures. Nine years after the original theatrical release of “Count Yorga, Vampire;” Arkoff sold American-International Pictures to television and feature film production/syndication company Filmways in 1979, which was later acquired by Orion Pictures in 1982. Orion, along with the majority of the American-International (AIP)/Filmways holdings was then sold to the present incarnation of Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer (MGM) in 1997. Inspired by MGM’s recent revival of the “Orion Pictures” moniker, the modern incarnation of MGM recently revived the “American-International Pictures” (AIP) moniker for certain theatrical releases/theatrical feature film productions.

One year before working on “Count Yorga, Vampire;” Kelljan previously appeared in the role of Arthur in Richard Rush‘s classic mammoth American-International psychedelic drama masterpiece production of “Psych-Out” (1968) with Susan Strasberg, Dean Stockwell, young Jack Nicholson, Bruce Dern, Adam Roarke, Max Julien young Garry Marshall, and The Strawberry Alarm Clock; “Psych-Out” was co-produced by disc jockey and TV host Dick Clark (of “American Bandstand” fame). Kelljan later directed the classic mammoth American-International vampire masterpiece production sequel to William Crain‘s earlier classic mammoth 1972 American-International vampire masterpiece production of “Blacula;” titled “Scream, Blacula Scream” (1973) with William Marshall (who later portrayed the “King of Cartoons” with Paul “Pee-Wee Herman” Reubens in Reubens/Herman’s classic mammoth CBS Saturday Morning masterpiece series, “Pee-Wee’s Playhouse” from 1987-90), Pam Grier, Barbara Rhoades, Lynne Moody, Bernie Hamilton, Bob Minor, Don Mitchell and Michael Conrad and later directed eight episodes of the classic mammoth Aaron Spelling–Leonard Goldberg/ABC television action-detective masterpiece series; “Starsky & Hutch” (Kelljan worked on the series from 1975-78).

Veteran actor Michael Macready served as the producer for Kelljan’s classic mammoth 1970 American-International vampire monster masterpiece production during his brief producing career alongside his acting career.

Who was in Bob Kelljan’s classic mammoth American-International vampire masterpiece production of “Count Yorga, Vampire” (1970)?

The players who appeared in Bob Kelljan’s classic mammoth 1970 American-International vampire masterpiece production of “Count Yorga, Vampire” were Robert Quarry (as Count Yorga), Roger Perry (as Dr. James “Jim” Hayes), Michael Murphy (as Paul), a cameo by co-producer Michael Macready (as Michael “Mike” Thompson), Donna Anders (as Donna), Judy Lang (as Erica Landers), Edward Walsh (as Brudah), Julie Conners (as Cleo), Paul Hansen (as Peter), Sybil Scotford (as Judy), Marsha Jordan (as Donna’s Mother), Deborah Darnell (as a Vampire Woman), George Macready (as the narrator), Erica Macready (in an uncredited role as Babette), Mark Tapscott (in an uncredited role as a seance guest) and Stella Thomas (as a Vampire Woman).

Early in his acting career, Robert Quarry appeared in an uncredited role of a teenager in Alfred Hitchcock‘s classic mammoth Universal Studios mystery-suspense masterpiece production with Teresa Wright, Joseph Cotten (of Orson Welles’ “Citizen Kane” fame), Macdonald Carey, Henry Travers (of 1933’s “The Invisible Man,” 1941’s “Ball of Fire,” 1945’s “The Bells of St. Mary’s” and 1946’s “It’s A Wonderful Life” fame), Hume Cronyn, Patricia Collinge and Irving Bacon; “Shadow of a Doubt” (1943). In 1965, Quarry appeared in two episodes of the classic mammoth CBS television courtroom drama masterpiece series adaptation of Erle Stanley Garnder‘s “Perry Mason” with Raymond Burr, Barbara Hale, William Hopper and William Talman; Quarry appeared in the 1965 episodes “The Case of the Deadly Debt” and “The Case of the 12th Wildcat.” To paraphrase Sven, “Robert Quarry appeared in two episodes of.. ‘Perry Mason‘!” -C.H. He also appe

ared in Robert Fuest‘s classic mammoth American-International “Dr. Phibes” thriller sequel masterpiece with Vincent Price, Peter Cushing, Beryl Reid, Terry-Thomas andJohn Comer (of BBC‘s “Last of the Summer Wine” fame); “Dr. Phibes Rises Again” (1972). Quarry later appeared in the role of Doc Burnside in Fred Olen Ray‘s cult production of “Alienator” (1989/90) with Jan-Michael Vincent, John Phillip Law. Dyana Ortelli, Ross Hagen, P.J. Soles and Richard Wiley. In an ironic twist, “Alienator” (1989/90) also wound up with Orion Pictures and in the same fashion with the majority of the American-International/Filmways/Orion holdings, the current incarnation of MGM currently owns the rights; according to the reverse cover art of the Shout! Factory/Scream Factory Blu-Ray release. -C.H.

Throughout her brief acting career, Judy Lang previously appeared in the role of Jill Hartwood in the classic mammoth Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer (MGM)/NBC television drama series masterpiece adaptation of “Dr. Kildare” with Richard Chamberlain (later of “Shogun” fame), Raymond Massey (of 1940’s “Abe Lincoln in Illinois,” 1944’s “Arsenic and Old Lace” and 1955’s “East of Eden” fame); Lang appeared in five episodes of the series in 1965. “Count Yorga, Vampire” (1970) also marked one of Lang’s final acting appearances. Roger Perry previously appeared in the role of Det. Sgt. Dan Kirby in the MCA-Universal-Revue/ABC television crime drama series, “Arrest and Trial” (1963-65) with Ben Gazzara (of TV’s “Run for Your Life” fame) and Chuck Connors (of TV’s “The Rifleman” and “Branded” fame). Perry also appeared in the role of Ted Bradley in an episode of the classic mammoth Universal Studios-MCA/CBS television “Munster” monster comedy masterpiece series with Fred Gwynne, Yvonne De Carlo, Al Lewis, Pat Priest and Butch Patrick; “The Munsters” in the 1965 episode “A Man for Marilyn.”

In addition to his numerous feature film and television appearances throughout his screen career, Michael Murphy later appeared in the role of Mr. Smith in Peter Bogdanovich‘s classic mammoth Warner Bros. comedy masterpiece with Barbra Streisand, Ryan O’Neal, Madeline Kahn, Kenneth Mars (later of Mel Brooks‘ “Young Frankenstein” fame), John Hillerman, Austin Pendleton, Sorrell Booke (later of TV’s “The Dukes of Hazard” fame), Liam Dunn, Mabel Albertson and Graham Jarvis, “What’s Up, Doc?” (1972). Murphy later appeared in the title role of Jack Tanner in Robert Altman‘s brief classic mammoth critically-acclaimed political satire mockumentary miniseries for the Home Box Office (HBO) premium cable network, “Tanner ’88” (1988) with Pamela Reed, Veronica Cartwright, Matt Malloy, Cynthia Nixon and guest appearances of country/western music legend Waylon Jennings, Cleavon Little (of Mel Brooks’ “Blazing Saddles” fame), E.G. Marshall and Harry Anderson (of TV’s “Night Court” fame) and was written by veteran author-writer-cartoonist Garry Trudeau (of “Doonesbury” fame). Murphy later narrated several historical documentaries for the classic mammoth critically-acclaimed WGBH (GBH) Boston/PBS public television documentary masterpiece series, “American Experience” from 2011–20. The real-life father of Michael Macready, George Macready appeared in numerous feature film and TV roles throughout his acti’ng career. The senior Macready previously appeared in the role of Ballin Mundson in Charles Vidor ‘s classic mammoth Columbia Pictures film noir drama masterpiece with Rita Hayworth, Glenn Ford, Joe Sawyer and Joseph Calleia; “Gilda” (1946) and also appeared in the role of Gen. Kuhster in Blake Edwards‘ classic mammoth Warner Bros. comedy masterpiece with Tony Curtis, Natalie Wood, Jack Lemmon, a pre-“Columbo” Peter Falk, Keenan Wynn, Larry Storch (of Warners’ “F-Troop” fame and of interest of fellow Super Tooners/Super SvenPals of Toony & Bill’s “Toon In With Me-“ Storch’s “Cool Cat” vocalizations for the final series of the original theatrical run of classic mammoth Warner Bros. cartoon masterpieces), Dorothy Provine, Vivian Vance (of “I Love Lucy” fame), Denver Pyle and Hal Smith (of “The Andy Griffith Show” fame), “The Great Race” (1965).

Original working title for the American-International production of “Count Yorga, Vampire” (1970)

According to additional details from IMDB and Jeff Stafford’s 2007 classic Turner Classic Movies online article on the production of “Count Yorga, Vampire;” the original working title for Bob Kelljan’s classic mammoth American-International vampire masterpiece production of “Count Yorga, Vampire” (1970) was “Count Iorga: Vampire” and was originally intended as a different kind of “vampire” feature film with graphic scenes and graphic depictions. Kelljan’s original idea did not sit well with Arkoff and Nicholson’s American-International.

It was reported that several American-International preview release prints of “Count Yorga, Vampire” (1971) still contained the “Count Iorga, Vampire” title. When Rober Quarry was cast for the role of the title role Vampire, both Kelljan and Macready decided to drop the graphic exploitation elements and make a traditional monster/vampire film for Samuel Z. Arkoff and James H. Nicholson’s American-International Pictures.

Robert Quarry: American-International’s newest horror/monster feature film superstar at the time of the production of “Count Yorga, Vampire” (1970)

During the production of “Count Yorga, Vampire” (1970); it was reported that Robert Quarry was one of American-International’s newest horror/monster feature film superstars during Kelljan’s classic mammoth vampire masterpiece production.

According to a brief segment with veteran film historian/author Kim Newman from Arrow Video’s online advertisement for “The Count Yorga Collection” Blu-Ray box set, he noted that when Quarry was given an American-International feature film contract from Arkoff and Nicholson’s firm; it wasn’t an ordinary American-International feature film contract; the contract had the same conditions as the American-International film contract for the legendary Vincent Price for his numerous appearances in Arkoff and Nicholson’s feature film releases. He was being groomed as the “new Vincent Price” of American-International Pictures.

Robert Quarry/Count Yorga’s “Fangs” for “Count Yorga, Vampire” (1970)

According to the American Film Institute (AFI)’s database article entry on Kelljan’s classic mammoth 1970 vampire monster masterpiece production for American-International; it was reported that Kelljan hired a local Los Angeles, California Dentist for the production of “Count Yorga, Vampire.” The reasoning for this was that the Dentist was a major aficionado of horror and monster feature films and Kelljan thought that he would be a perfect fit for his production of “Count Yorga, Vampire.”

In exchange, the Dentist created a series of custom Vampire “Fang” dental applications for Roberrt Quarry’s characterization of Count Yorga.

Bob Kelljan’s American-International production of “Count Yorga, Vampire” (1970): Filmed on an economical budget

According to additional details from Jeff Stafford’s 2007 TCM online article on Kelljan’s classic mammoth American-International vampire feature film masterpiece production of “Count Yorga, Vampire” (1970); the feature production was filmed on a tight budget. The allocated production budget was $64,000. According to additional details from the AFI database article, it was reported that Kelljan raised the funds himself for the production of “Count Yorga, Vampire.” The film turned out to be a surprise major box-office success from coast-to-coast for Kelljan, along with Samuel Z. Arkoff and James Nicholson’s American-International.

The majority of the scenes for Robert Quarry’s title characterization for the character of Count Yorga in Kelljan’s 1970 production were filmed in the evening as part of a contract clause for Quarry. It was reported that Quarry’s “Count Yorga” scenes were filmed in the evening as he spent the majority of the day appearing in another feature film that was filmed by a rival studio around the same time that Count Yorga was in production. The other film that Quarry appeared in that same year was in the role of Noonan in Stuart Rosenberg‘s Paramount Pictures production of “WUSA” (1970)* with Paul Newman, Joanne Woodward, Anthony Perkins (of Alfred Hitchcock’s “Psycho” fame), Laurence Harvey, Pat Hingle, Bruce Cabot, a-pre “Mary Tyler Moore Show” and a pre-“Young Frankenstein” Cloris Leachman and a pre-“M*A*S*H” Wayne Rogers.

*Sidebar: “WUSA” (1970) is not connected to the CBS television affiliate in the Washington, D.C./Frederick, Maryland region; Channel 9/W*USA (which has held the “W*USA” call sign since 1986; originally named for then-owner Gannett’s “USA Today” newspaper). -C.H.

American-International’s promotion for “Count Yorga, Vampire” (1970) via radio spots

According to a rare 45 r.p.m. recording that was unearthed on Discogs, American-International Pictures sent out promotional radio spots to local radio stations from coast-to-coast on 45 r.p.m. single discs for disc jockeys/broadcasters to play in-between commercial breaks for their music programs/radio programs for their local town and the cinema that showcased the classic mammoth Bob Kelljan/American-International vampire masterpiece production of “Count, Yorga Vampire.”

The promotional spot radio ads for “Count Yorga, Vampire” (1970) on the American-International 45 r.p.m. single were offered in 60-second and 30-second versions. Disc jockeys/broadcasters/personalities were also given the name of the cinema(s) that were showcasing “Count Yorga, Vampire” (1970) for the live script copy at the end of the spot recordings.

Around this time, American-International also had their own record label, American-International Records (a.ka. “AiR” Records by the time that “Count Yorga, Vampire” was released); which was one of two brief recorded music imprints that American-International established to compliment their feature film operations, beginning in 1959-60 and from 1970–79; according to Discogs.

One year after the original theatrical release of American-International’s “Count Yorga, Vampire” (1970): A sequel

One year after the original American-International theatrical release of “Count Yorga, Vampire” (1970); Bob Kelljan was asked by American-International to produce a sequel, titled “The Return of Count Yorga” (1971); according to additional details from the American Film Institute article. Quarry, Perry and the senior Macready reprised their roles for the sequel production with the addition of Mariette Hartley and young Craig T. Nelson. “The Return of Count Yorga” (1971) marked one of the final feature film appearances for George Macready; according to additional details from IMDB.

Be sure to watch Svengoolie’s big Me-TV broadcast premiere of “Count Yorga, Vampire” (1970); plus Sventoonie for Sven’s “Halloween ‘BOO’nanza;” this Sat. on Me-TV!

With Robert Quarry, Roger Perry, Michael Murphy, Michael Macready, Donna Anders, Judy Lang, Edward Walsh, Julie Conners, Paul Hansen, Sybil Scotford, Marsha Jordan, Deborah Darnell, George Macready, Erica Macready, Mark Tapscott and Stella Thomas; you will not want to miss out on Svengoolie’s big coast-to-coast broadcast premiere of Bob Kelljan’s classic mammoth American-International vampire masterpiece; “Count Yorga, Vampire” (1970); this Sat. on Me-TV! Escape from stress and anxiety with the magic and fun of Sven with Sven’s extended fun facts, maestro Sven and maestro Doug’s parody song, Sven and Kerwyn’s “mail call,” “Sventoonie” and much, much more! One of many perfect and wonderful Sven, “Sventoonie” & “Toon In” treats just before Halloween! You will not be disappointed! Highly recommended to all fellow Super SvenPals/Super Tooners/Super aficionados of classic mammoth vampire and classic mammoth American-International vampire masterpiece productions everywhere!

Safe, healthy & happy early Halloween 2022 greetings to all fellow Super SvenPals/Super Tooners/Super readers of “Silver Screen Reflections” who observe/celebrate from the author/writer of “Silver Screen Reflections!” -C.H.

“Svengoolie” presents his big coast-to-coast broadcast premiere of “Count Yorga, Vampire” (1970) plus Sventoonie for Sven’s “Halloween ‘BOO’nanza”

Sat., Oct. 29 at 8 p.m. Eastern/7 p.m. Central on Me-TV

To all fellow Super Svengoolie SvenPals/fellow Super “Toon In With Me” Tooners/fellow Super readers/fellow subscribers of “Silver Screen Reflections” everywhere: Seriously, Please, please be good, kind, courteous, safe and respectful to each other. Let’s all look to positive/uplifting enlightenment, wisdom and encouragement from Svengoolie, all fellow super Svengoolie SvenPals everywhere, all fellow super Me-TV “Toon In With Me”/”Saturday Morning Cartoons” Tooners, all fellow super Mystery Science Theater 3000/MST3K MSTies everywhere and all fellow super classic film/television aficionados everywhere. Again, to all fellow super Svengoolie SvenPals and all fellow super Me-TV “Toon In With Me”/”Saturday Morning Cartoons” Tooners, fellow super MST3K MSTies & fellow super classic film & TV aficionados everywhere; safety first, to our fellow super SvenPals/MSTies/Tooners who have not made a plan to get their vaccines yet, be sure to schedule your vaccines & booster vaccines by contacting your doctor/physician/healthcare professional soon, follow all precautions safely and seriously, wear a protective face mask/appropriate protective face covering, wash your hands for approximately 20 sec., avoid touching your face, practice proper social distancing/physical distancing protocols, use a tissue/sleeve when coughing/sneezing, stay home, keep healthy and stay well. Again, let’s all take preventative measures/steps by being safe, keeping healthy and staying well- and again, we fellow Super SvenPals everywhere highly recommend watching Kerwyn’s informative coronavirus/COVID-19 prevention safety public service announcement! Escape from anxiety, chaos and stress by relaxing and having fun with Sven and his Sat. evening big broadcasts of classic creature/sci-fi/monster/horror/fantasy feature film masterpieces on Me-TV’s big broadcast airlanes & Sven’s fifth Sat. big broadcast evening “Svengoolie’s Halloween ‘BOO’nanza” edotopm featuring Sven’s big broadcasts of his Me-TV premiere of “Count Yorga, Vampire” (1970) and “Sventoonie!” Join in on the fun with all fellow super SvenPals everywhere by live-tweeting on the Twitter airlanes during Sven’s Sat. evening big broadcasts and.or Toony & Bill’s “Toon In With Me!” Again, be good, safety first, keep healthy and stay well, Sven/Rich Koz, the entire Sven/Sventoonie/”Toon In”/Me-TV production team & the entire crowd of fellow super Svengoolie SvenPals everywhere! To quote Svengoolie’s executive producer, Jim Roche: “#KeepCalmAndWatchSven!” –C.H.

***Update: As of this writing, Some segments are still being updated into this edition of “Silver Screen Reflections.” -C.H.***

Be sure to watch Toony & Bill’s “Toon In With Me” big broadcasts weekday mornings at 7 a.m. Eastern/6 a.m. Central on the airlanes of Me-TV! And be sure to watch “Sventoonie” after Svengoolie with Toony/Sventoonie, Blob E. Blob, & Trevor after Sven Sat. evenings at 10 p.m. Eastern/9 p.m. Central on most Me-TV stations! This Sat., Sventoonie will be having a one-hour Halloween special and tribute to the cult classic mammoth Joseph E. Levine-Nicholas Webster Embassy holiday-fantasy masterpiece and MST3K favorite, “Santa Claus Conquers the Martians” (1964)! And Good News, fellow Super Tooners/Super SvenPals! I will be joining all of you on Thurs. Morning, Oct. 27 for Toony & Bill’s “Sneezing” edition of “Toon In With Me!” -C.H.

Extra! Extra! Extra! Be sure to watch the upcoming Oct. 30 big broadcast encored of “Svengoolie: Uncrypted” featuring Sven/Rich Koz, Sven’s executive producer Jim Roche and guest cameo appearances by fellow Super Svengoolie/Sventoonie SvenPals/Super “Toon In With Me” Tooners Sarah Rhodes/Sarahgoolie and Nanette Keir Sun. Afternoon, Oct. 30 at Noon Eastern/11 a.m. Central on most Me-TV stations! I’m hoping that all my airlanes will be fully operational for the complete big broadcast of “Sventoonie: Uncrypted” featuring Sven/Rich Koz, Jim Roche & fellow Super SvenPals/Super Tooners Sarah/Sarahgoolie & Nanette on the airlanes of Me-TV! -C.H.

Extra! Extra! Extra! Rich Koz/Svengoolie’s recent guest appearance with professional wrestling legend Lisa Marie Veron, Valerie Wyndham and Mickie James Aldis’ “GAWTV” Show is now available on the official “GAWTV” YouTube site!

Extra! Extra! Extra! Me-TV’s official “Spawn of Svengoolie” Super SvenPals contest is still going on through the new Svengoolie smartphone app! The fellow Super SvenPal who wins the contest will be featured in future Svengoolie big broadcasts to be the official “Spawn of Svengoolie!” You could share Sven art, Sven jokes, and/or you could be one of many guest experts for Sven’s numerous favorite classic mammoth monster, sci-fi, horror, thriller fantasy and horror-comedy feature film masterpieces and much, much more! Again, be sure to download the official Me-TV “Svengoolie Smartphone App” to record and enter your Sven/”Spawn of Sven” audition! through the official Sven app! Be sure to follow all official rules/directions on the official Sven smartphone app to enter! Update: As of this writing, the writer/author of “Silver Screen Reflections” has officially entered/submitted the audition video for the official Me-TV “Spawn of Svengoolie” contest via the official Svengoolie smartphone app! Again, three cheers/two thumbs up to all fellow Super SvenPals/Super Tooners who will enter in the contest! Again, Peace to all & Shake a leg, everyone! -C.H.

Extra! Extra! Extra! Get your last-minute official Sven/Sventoonie/”Toon In” goods for Halloween via the official Svengoolie/Sventoonie/”Toon In With Me”/Me-TV online stores! Including the official “Svengoolie: Uncrypted” line of limited edition buttons, the new Sven button-up tee, the new Svengoolie & Kerwyn bobblehead set, official Sven & “Toon In With Me” mugs & Tervis tumblers, official Sven, Sventoonie & “Toon In With Me” apparel items, Scott Shaw’s “Welcome to the Sveniverse” tee, Sven phone cases & much, much more! Perfect for any occasion! And finish your shopping early for the upcoming season of winter holidays! There’s something for everyone and for every season/occasion! To quote Sven, “No personal checks!” And only purchase official Sven, Sventoonie, “Toon In With Me” and/or Me-TV items/officially licensed items! -C.H.

Extra! Extra! Extra! Cameo mentions of fellow Super Svengoolie/Sventoonie SvenPals/Super “Toon In With Me” Tooners!

For the cameo mentions of fellow Super Tooners/Super SvenPals for this week, this will be a combination post in connection to Sven/Rich’s recent Berwyn/Chicago festival visits with fellow Super SvenPals/Super Tooners, guest cameos by fellow Super SvenPals/Super Tooners from one of the recent Sven events and a recent Sven article from one of our fellow Super SvenPals/Super Tooners in connection to a recent Berwyn/Chicago Sven festival & the “Sven: Uncrypted” documentary & cameo mentions in connection to Svem on the social media airlanes! -C.H.

Extra! Extra! Extra! Fellow Super Svengoolie/Sventoonie SvenPals/Super “Toon In With Me” Tooners danced & jumped for joy when several of our fellow Super SvenPals/Super Tooners was featured in a recent article written by one of our fellow Super SvenPals/Super Tooners! Fellow Super Svengoolie SvenPal/Super “Toon In With Me” Tooners danced & jumped for joy when fellow Super Svengoolie SvenPal/Super “Toon In With Me” Tooner Dave Fuentes wrote his recent “Terror From Beyond the Dave” article on Sven’s recent return to Chicago’s “Flashback Weekend 2022” festival featuring fellow Super Svengoolie/Sventoonie SvenPals/Super “Toon In With Me” Tooners Sarah Rhodes/Sarahgoolie & Nanette Keir! Plus, Dave also mentioned highlights of the “Sinister Visions Costume Contest” with Sven and Nick Digilio, the presenting of the Rondo Award to Sven & the Rondo “Monster Kid of the Year” award from Rondo Award founder David Colton, plus moments of the “Sven: Uncrypted” documentary with Sventoonie, Dave’s mention of Sarah/Sarahgoolie’s mention in the Wall Street Journal Sven article and Sarah/Sarahgoolie’s cameo guest appearance on NBC’s WMAQ-TV 5 Chicago News for C2E2, Sarah/Sarahgoolie & Nanette’s guest cameo appearances for “Sven: Uncrypted,” Dave’s cameo mentions of fellow Super SvenPals/Super Tooners Sarah Rhodes/Sarahgoolie, Nanette Keir and the author/writer of “Silver Screen Reflections” in connection to the growing coast-to-coast popularity of Svengoolie’s big Me-TV broadcasts through the social media airlanes and much, much more! Be sure to read Dave’s recent “Terror from Beyond the Dave” article on Sven’s “Flashback Weekend” & “Sven Uncrypted” moments with Sarah/Sarahgoolie, Nanette & the cameo mentions of Sarah/Sarahgoolie, Nanette & the writer/author of “Silver Screen Reflections!”

Extra! Extra! Extra! Wait! There’s more! Fellow Super Svengoolie SvenPals/Super “Toon In With Me” Tooners/Super “Jammin’ with Jamie” jammers danced & jumped for joy when fellow Super Svengoolie SvenPals/Super “Toon In With Me” Tooners Nanette Keir & Drew Love met Svengoolie/Rich Koz in-person at the Elgin “Nightmare on Chicago Street 2022” festival, along with fellow Super Svengoolie & Sventoonie SvenPal/Super “Toon In With Me” Tooner/Super “Jammin’ with Jamie” Jammer Sarah Rhodes/Sarahgoolie through the virtual airlanes and Sven executive producer Jim Roche! Nanette & Drew also shared highlights of the “Nightmare on Chicago Street” festivities, along with the costume contest with Sven!

Extra! Extra! Extra! Wait! Wait! There’s more! Fellow Super Svengoolie SvenPal/Super “Toon In With Me” Tooners danced & jumped for joy when fellow Super Svengoolie SvenPal/Super “Toon In With Me” Tooner/Super “Jammin’ with Jamie” Jammer Jamie Lee and the entire Elgin “Nightmare on Chicago Street” dance troupe danced to Rockapella’s classic mammoth 1990 Elektra Records recording masterpiece rendition of “Zombie Jamboree,” which is also a “Jammin’ with Jamie” favorite on Jamie’s WNUR/Northwestern University Radio “Jammin’ with Jamie” big broadcasts! Jamie chose the song for the troupe and also choreographed the “Zombie Jamboree” dance show for the 2022 Elgin “Nightmare on Chicago Street” festival on the “Decade of Doom” stage! Fellow Super SvenPals/Super Tooners/Super Jammers Nanette & Drew also visited Jamie in-person during the “Nightmare on Chicago Street” event/”Zombie Jamboree” dance event!

https://twitter.com/DoctorRhodes/status/1585263432042876928

Congratulations to Dave on your wonderful “Terror From Beyond the Dave” article on Sven’s recent “Nightmare on Chicago Street” return & the “Svengoolie: Uncrypted” documentary with fellow Super SvenPals/Super Tooners Sarah Rhodes/Sarahgoolie & Drew! Congratulations to Sarah/Sarahgoolie & Nanette on being featured in Dave’s recent “Terror From Beyond the Dave” article & the cameo mentions! And on behalf of all of us fellow Super Tooners/Super SvenPals, we thank you for the wonderful cameo mentions in your recent “Terror From Beyond the Dave” article, Dave! We all highly appreciate them all! Congratulations to Nanette & Drew on your recent “Nightmare on Chicago Street” event visit & seeing Sven, Jim & Jamie in person! Congratulations to Sarah/Sarahgoolie on virtually seeing Sven, Jim, Nanette & Drew from the “Nightmare on Chicago Street” festival! Congratulations to Jamie & the entire “Nightmare on Chicago Street” troupe on your recent “Zombie Jamboree” dance show during the Elgin “Nightmare on Chicago Street” festival & on seeing Sven, Nanette & Drew! I’m very glad to hear that you all enjoyed the festivities! Very awesome, neat & cool! We’re all dancing & jumping for joy for all of you, Dave, Sarah/Sarahgoolie, Nanette, Drew, Jamie & all fellow Super SvenPals/Super Tooners! Good News! See you all for the Thurs. Toony & Bill “Sneezing” edition of “Toon In With Me” this Thurs. morning, Dave, Sarah/Sarahgoolie, Nanette, Drew & all fellow Super SvenPals/Super Tooners! Keep up the wonderful/excellent work, three cheers, two thumbs up, safety first, keep healthy, stay well & all the best to you & all fellow Super SvenPals/Super Tooners, Super broadcasters & Super DJs everywhere, Sarah/Sarahgoolie & Jamie & all to fellow Super SvenPals/Super Tooners everywhere, Dave, Sarah/Sarahgoolie, Nanette, Drew & Jamie! Cheers! “Yee-Howdy!” Yippee! Hooray! Woo-Hoo! “Hi-Keeba!”

In the future, I hope to visit my fellow Super SvenPals/Super Tooners from Coast-to-Coast in-person & from Berwyn/Chicago in-person and Sven in-person for a future Berwyn/Chicago Sven visit to accomplish one of my “Bucket List” trips! Fingers crossed! -C.H.

Extra! Extra! Extra! Sidebar: I missed the segment due to several brief Internet Outages during Toony & Bill’s Oct. 26 edition of “Toon In.” -C.H. Fellow Super Svengoolie/Sventoonie SvenPals/Super “Toon In With Me” Tooners danced & jumped for joy when fellow Super SvenPal/Super Tooner Makayla Stormer’s wonderful Toony & Bill Halloween art creation masterpiece was featured in Toony & Bill’s “mail call” segment for Toony & Bill’s “Gourd Festival” edition of “Toon In With Me!”

Congratulations to Makayla on your wonderful “Toon In With Me Toony & Bill” Halloween costume art creation masterpiece cameo featured on “Toon In With Me!” Very awesome, neat & cool! We’re all dancing & jumping for joy for all of you, Makayla & all fellow Super SvenPals/Super Tooners! Good News! See you all for the Thurs. Toony & Bill “Sneezing” edition of “Toon In With Me” this Thurs. morning, Makayla & all fellow Super SvenPals/Super Tooners! In connection to “Count Yorga, Vampire” (1970):

Bob Kelljan’s classic mammoth American-International vampire masterpiece, “Count Yorga, Vampire” (1970) is also available on Blu-Ray disc as part of Arrow Films/Arrow Video’s “The Count Yorga Collection” (sourced from a recent 4K restoration from the original 35mm elements authorized by the current incarnation of Metro-Goldwyn Mayer), by arrangement with the current incarnation of Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer/MGM (part of MGM’s American-International/Filmways/Orion holdings).
